intro: Impatiens luchunensis, commonly known as the Luchun impatiens, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant is herbaceous, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
